guide.conclusion: Have fun! There will be another one coming soon!

flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Have fun and be careful out there!
guide.introduction_rendered:
Have fun and be careful out there!

Relevant parts
  • Wood clothespin
  • Screws or nails
  • Thin plywood
Tools
  • Sander
  • Sandpaper
  • Table saw (if you have one), or you could use a bandsaw, or the old fashioned hand saw

lines.text: Sorry, I don't have any pics from when I was building it so I'm describing it as best I can now.
lines.text_raw: Sorry, I don't have any pics from when I was building it so I'm describing it as best I can now.

lines.text: To load it, hook a rubber band over the notch at the end and stretch it over near the clothespin.
lines.text_raw: To load it, hook a rubber band over the notch at the end and stretch it over near the clothespin.

lines.text: Clip the rubber band in one of the clothespins. Repeat with another rubber band, using the other clothespin.
lines.text_raw: Clip the rubber band in one of the clothespins. Repeat with another rubber band, using the other clothespin.

lines.text: Make sure the rubber bands are held properly, otherwise the gun could fire unexpectedly.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the rubber bands are held properly, otherwise the gun could fire unexpectedly.

lines.text: To fire, simply press open the clothespin and see how far the rubber band goes!
lines.text_raw: To fire, simply press open the clothespin and see how far the rubber band goes!

lines.text: Do not point or fire at anyone without asking.
lines.text_raw: Do not point or fire at anyone without asking.

guide.summary: How to make a 25-round FULL-AUTO rubber-band submachine gun.
guide.time_required: 30 min depending on tools and experience
guide.title: Rubber Band Gun V3

tools.text: Table saw (if you have one), or you could use a bandsaw, or the old fashioned hand saw
